Name: Abderahmane Eloosi
BioText:
Early Life and Education

Abderahmane Eloosi, renowned for his exceptional recitation of the Quran, was born in Morocco. Growing up in a devout Muslim family, Eloosi was introduced to the teachings of Islam and the Quran at an early age. His parents recognized his talent and dedication to reciting the Quran and supported him in pursuing formal education in Islamic studies.

Islamic Studies and Training

Eloosi's journey into Quranic recitation began at a local madrasa, where he was taught the basics of Quranic Arabic and tajweed (the art of Quranic recitation). He showed remarkable proficiency and passion for learning, which led him to further his studies at prestigious Islamic institutions. Under the guidance of renowned scholars and reciters, Eloosi honed his skills and deepened his understanding of the Quran's meanings and pronunciations.

Career and Contributions

Abderahmane Eloosi gained recognition for his melodious and precise recitation of the Quran. His voice, characterized by clarity and emotional depth, resonated with listeners, drawing them closer to the spiritual message of the Quran. Eloosi's recitations became widely sought after for religious events, gatherings, and recordings.

Abd al-Rahman bin Jamal bin Abd al-Rahman al-Awsi is a teacher and imam of the Al-Ikhlas Mosque in Al-Khobar, located in the Corniche neighborhood of Saudi Arabia. He is certified in the Hafs narration from Asim. Born on May 5, 1980, Abd al-Rahman al-Awsi gained significant recognition on social media after a video of him leading the Tarawih prayer at the Ali Ibn Abi Talib Mosque in Al-Ahsa city was published in 1436 AH.

In addition to his recitation, Eloosi dedicated himself to teaching others the art of Quranic recitation. He conducted workshops, seminars, and classes, sharing his knowledge and inspiring a new generation of reciters. His commitment to preserving the traditional methods of recitation while incorporating modern techniques made him a respected figure in the Islamic community.

Impact and Legacy

Abderahmane Eloosi's contributions to Quranic recitation have left a lasting impact on both the local and global Muslim communities. His recordings are cherished by those seeking to connect with the Quran through beautiful and accurate recitation. Eloosi's dedication to teaching has also ensured that the art of Quranic recitation continues to thrive among younger generations.

Personal Life

Despite his fame, Eloosi remained humble and devoted to his faith. He emphasized the importance of sincerity and devotion in reciting the Quran, encouraging others to approach the holy text with reverence and love. Eloosi's life and work serve as an inspiration to those striving to deepen their relationship with the Quran and their faith.

Conclusion

Abderahmane Eloosi's legacy as a Quran reciter and educator continues to inspire Muslims around the world. His dedication to the art of Quranic recitation and his commitment to teaching have made him a revered figure in the Islamic community, leaving an indelible mark on the hearts and minds of those who have had the privilege of hearing his recitations.

Name: Abdulwadood Haneef
BioText:
Early Life and Education

Abdulwadood Haneef, celebrated for his soulful and eloquent recitation of the Quran, was born in Saudi Arabia. From a young age, he displayed a deep connection to the Quran, nurtured by a family committed to Islamic values. His parents played a crucial role in encouraging his passion for Quranic recitation and supported his pursuit of religious education.

Islamic Studies and Training

Haneef began his journey in Quranic recitation at a local madrasa, where he quickly excelled in memorizing the Quran and mastering tajweed (the rules of Quranic recitation). Recognizing his extraordinary talent, he continued his education at esteemed Islamic institutions, where he studied under prominent scholars and reciters. This rigorous training refined his skills and deepened his understanding of the Quran's profound meanings.

Career and Contributions

Abdulwadood Haneef rose to prominence due to his clear, powerful, and moving recitations of the Quran. His voice, noted for its richness and emotional resonance, captivated listeners and brought the words of the Quran to life. Haneef's recitations became highly sought after for religious ceremonies, events, and recordings, making him a beloved figure in the Muslim community.

Alongside his recitation career, Haneef committed himself to teaching the art of Quranic recitation. He conducted numerous workshops, seminars, and classes, sharing his expertise and inspiring aspiring reciters. His approach combined traditional techniques with contemporary insights, earning him respect and admiration in the field of Quranic studies.

Abdul Wadud Haneef, also known as Abdul Wadud Makboul Haneef, is a Saudi Arabian Qur’an reciter and Imam. He led prayers at the Prophet’s Mosque in Madina Monawara for a year in 1414 Hijri before moving to Al Amira Shahida’s Mosque. Abdul Wadud Haneef has released recordings of his recitations, which are broadcast on many TV channels and radio stations.

Impact and Legacy

Abdulwadood Haneef's contributions to Quranic recitation have had a profound impact on the global Muslim community. His recordings are treasured by those seeking a deeper spiritual connection through the Quran. Haneef's dedication to education has ensured that the tradition of Quranic recitation continues to flourish, influencing countless students and reciters worldwide.

Personal Life

Despite his widespread acclaim, Haneef remained humble and dedicated to his faith. He emphasized the importance of sincerity, humility, and devotion in reciting the Quran, encouraging others to engage with the holy text with reverence and passion. Haneef's life and work continue to serve as a beacon of inspiration for those committed to the Quran and its teachings.

Name: Emad Al Mansary
BioText:
Sheikh Emad Al Mansary is a renowned Saudi Quran reciter, serving as the imam and khatib of Al-Kawthar Mosque in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Known for his melodious voice in Quranic recitation, anasheed (Islamic songs), and Duaa (invocations), Sheikh Emad was born in Jeddah where he memorized the Quran and received his early education in local mosques.

Under the nickname Abu Huzifa Al Madany, Sheikh Emad Al-Mansary has released numerous Islamic songs. He has served as an imam in various mosques and currently holds the position of imam and preacher at Al-Kawthar Mosque, one of Jeddah's largest and most renowned mosques.

Sheikh Emad leads daily prayers at Al-Kawthar Mosque and also leads Taraweeh and Qiyam prayers during Ramadan each year. He delivers Khutba (sermons) on Fridays and Eid celebrations.

Sheikh Emad recorded the entire Quran in the Hafs from Asim reading style with his own voice. His recitations are often recorded at Al-Kawthar Mosque and shared on social media platforms.

During Ramadan, many people flock to Al-Kawthar Mosque to pray behind Sheikh Emad and to experience his beautiful recitations and invocations (Duaa).

Personal Information

  • Full Name: Sheikh Emad Al Mansary
  • Birthplace: Jeddah, Saudi Arabia

Accomplishments

  • Memorized the Quran and received education in mosques in Jeddah
  • Recorded numerous Islamic songs under the nickname Abu Huzifa Al Madany
  • Imam and preacher at Al-Kawthar Mosque, Jeddah
  • Recorded the entire Quran in the Hafs from Asim reading style
  • Popular for his recitations and invocations during Ramadan

Name: Laayoun El Kouchi
BioText:
Sheikh Laayoun El Kouchi is a Moroccan Quran reciter, renowned for his recitation in the Warsh narration from Nafi'. Born in Safi, Morocco in 1967, he memorized the Quran before the age of nine with the guidance of a close relative, achieving this feat in just five years.

Sheikh Laayoun El Kouchi received his education in Moroccan public schools, where he became well-known for his distinctive voice. He was frequently invited to recite the Quran at numerous significant events.

After attending university and earning a bachelor's degree in literature, Sheikh Laayoun chose to dedicate his life to the Holy Quran. He has garnered numerous awards and achieved top positions in several international Quran competitions held in Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, and Tunisia.

Sheikh Laayoun El Kouchi began leading prayers as an imam at the age of 18 in mosques in Safi and Casablanca. He later moved to the United States, where he served as an imam at the Islamic Center in New York. He also spent four years in Belgium as an imam at Al Khalil Mosque in Brussels before returning to Morocco to become the imam and preacher at Al Andalus Mosque in Casablanca.

Sheikh Laayoun El Kouchi holds the distinction of being the first Moroccan reciter to record the entire Quran in the Warsh narration from Nafi'. This recording underwent a rigorous review process by more than 20 scholars from Al Azhar in Egypt over a period of three years.

Personal Information

  • Full Name: Sheikh Laayoun El Kouchi
  • Birthplace: Safi, Morocco
  • Date of Birth: 1967

Accomplishments

  • Memorized the Quran at a young age
  • Received a bachelor's degree in literature
  • Recorded the entire Quran in Warsh narration from Nafi'
  • Won numerous prizes and awards in international Quran competitions
  • Served as an imam in Morocco, United States, and Belgium

Name: Abdul Bari Ath Thobaity
BioText:
Sheikh Abdul Bari Bin Awad Al Thobaity was born in Mecca, Saudi Arabia in 1380 / 1960. His life is marked by numerous achievements in the field of Daa'wa (Islamic outreach) and voluntary work, including significant roles such as being the Imam of Masjid Haram (the Holy Mosque of Mecca) for several years. Currently, he serves as the Imam of Masjid Al-Nabawi (Prophet Muhammad Mosque) in Medina since the year 1414 / 1994.

Sheikh Abdul Bari's childhood was extraordinary as he memorized the Quran perfectly at a young age. He began teaching Quran and leading Muslims in prayer (Salat) at the age of 9, alongside his basic education, which was remarkable.

During his university studies at the Faculty of Science in King Abdul Aziz University, Sheikh Abdul Bari was appointed as an Imam at one of the mosques and achieved first place in the international competition of the Holy Quran in Mecca at the age of 19.

Throughout his career, Sheikh Abdul Bari Al Thobaity has served in various schools and mosques, earning the honor of being Imam at both Masjid Haram and Masjid Al-Nabawi, the most sacred mosques for Muslims.

Sheikh Abdul Bari faced a challenge when his vocal cords were injured and his voice was affected by illness, leading him to temporarily stop his work as an Imam and Quran reciter for 4 years. However, he returned to his role at Masjid Al-Nabawi after recovering.

His career has also included holding important positions in scientific and Islamic organizations, and he has made significant contributions to social, charitable, and voluntary work in Saudi Arabia.

Personal Information

  • Full Name: Sheikh Abdul Bari Bin Awad Al Thobaity
  • Birthplace: Mecca, Saudi Arabia
  • Date of Birth: 1380 / 1960

Accomplishments

  • Memorized the Quran at a young age
  • Appointed Imam of Masjid Haram and Masjid Al-Nabawi
  • Won first place in the international Quran competition in Mecca at age 19
  • Contributed significantly to social, charitable, and voluntary work in Saudi Arabia
  • Overcame vocal cord injury to return to his role as Imam

Name: Wadi Al Yamani
BioText:
Sheikh Wadi Hammad Al-Yamani is a prominent reciter based in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Islamic Studies from the Faculty of Arts, University of Science and Technology, alongside a Master's in Tafsir (Quranic exegesis).

Currently, Sheikh Wadi Hammad Al-Yamani serves as the Imam of “Abu Bakr As-Siddique” mosque in Sa`d Alabdullah’s area, Kuwait. Over the last 20 years, his recitations have captivated the hearts of thousands across the world.

  • Education: Bachelor's Degree in Islamic Studies, Master's in Tafsir

Current Position

Accomplishments

  • Known for captivating recitations of the Quran
  • 20 years of experience in Quranic recitation and teaching

Name: Yassen Al Jazairi
BioText:
Al Qarie Yassen, whose full name is Sheikh Yassen Al Jazairi, was born in Algeria. He is renowned as one of the most well-known Algerian Quran reciters.

Thanks to his passion and dedication to the religious world, Al Qarie Yassen achieved popularity and became a legend in a very short period of time across all Muslim countries, including his native country.

From a young age, Al Qarie Yassen learned and memorized the Holy Quran with ease and comfort, astonishing his family and relatives with his tremendous success.

His performances have been broadcasted on various TV channels and internet websites, including ours, showcasing his perfect and harmonious recitations.

Al Qarie Yassen has also recorded numerous tapes featuring his famous Quran recitations.

Personal Information

  • Full Name: Sheikh Yassen Al Jazairi
  • Birthplace: Algeria

Accomplishments

  • Renowned Algerian Quran reciter
  • Achieved popularity and celebrity status in Muslim countries
  • Recorded several tapes of famous Quran recitations

Name: Abd Al-Basit Mujawwad
BioText:
‘Abdul-Basit ‘Abdus-Samad (Arabic: عبـدُ الباسِـط مُحـمّـد عبـدُ ٱلصّـمـد), or Abdel Basit Abdel Samad, or Abdul Basit Muhammad Abdus Samad (1927 – 30 November 1988) was an Egyptian Quran reciter and Hafiz and is regarded as one of the best Quran reciters to have ever lived. He had won three world Qira'at competitions in the early 1970s. ‘Abdus-Samad was one of the first huffaz to make commercial recordings of his recitations and the first president of the Reciters' Union in Egypt. At 10, Abdul Basit finished learning the Quran. He also learned 7 styles of Quran recitation by the age of 12 and the 10 styles by 14. The quadrumvirate of Al-Minshawy, Abdul Basit, Mustafa Ismail, and Al-Hussary, who all belong to the Egyptian Reciting Style, are generally considered the most important and famous Qurra' of modern times to have had an outsized impact on the Islamic world. He came to be called the Golden Throat and the Voice of Heaven due to his melodious style, breath control, and unique emotional and engaging tone. He has a son, Tareq Abd El Basit Abd El Samad, who is also a known sheikh in Egypt; he has done many interviews on his father's life, family and career.

Early life

Sheikh Abdul Basit Abdul Samad was born in the year 1927 in the village of Al-Maarazeh situated in Qena Governorate (Egypt). From a very early age, he was very committed with the memorization and recitation of the Quran. His grandfather, Sheikh Abdul Samad, was well-known for his memorization of the Quran and known for his ability to memorize the Quran according to its rules of recitation (al-tajwid and al-ahkam). His father, Muhammad Abdul Samad, was also one of the great reciters of the Quran and worked as a civil servant in the Ministry of Communications.

Sheikh Abdul Basit Abdul Samad had two older brothers, Mahmoud and Abdul Hamid Abdul Samad. Both brothers were memorizing the Quran at the Madrasa, so their younger brother Abdul Basit joined them when he was six years old. The teacher of Abdul Basit noticed that his young student was quick in his memorization and very observant and keen to follow his teacher with all the pronunciation of the letters and the stop and start positions. His teacher also noticed his talent for recitation and great voice.

Education

Sheikh Abdul Basit Abdul Samad completed his memorization of the Qur'an at the age of ten and then requested his grandfather and father to continue his education with the Qira’at (recitations). They both agreed and sent him to the city of Tanta (Lower Egypt) to study the Quranic recitations (‘ulum al-Quran wa al-Qira’at) under the tutelage of Sheikh Muhammad Salim. Although the distance to travel to Tanta was very far, the young student was convinced and prepared to travel the long distance since this would lay an important foundation for his future.

One day before his departure to Tanta, the family heard about the arrival of Sheikh Muhammad Salim to the Religious Institute in Armant in order to settle there as a teacher of Recitations. The people received and welcomed him in the best way, because he was well known for his knowledge and abilities as a scholar of the Quran. It was as if fate brought this scholar to his family at the right time. The people of the city established an association in Asfun Al-Matanah to preserve the Quran, so that Sheikh Muhammad Salim could teach the memorization of the Quran and its recitations. Abdul Basit went to him and reviewed the entire Qur’an with him, and then memorized the Al-Shatibia, which is the classical text of the science of the seven recitations.

When Sheikh Abdul Basit reached the age of twelve, requests came from all the cities and villages of Qena Governorate (Egypt), especially Asfun Al-Matanah, with the help of Sheikh Muhammad Salim, who recommended Sheikh Abdul Basit everywhere he went, as Sheikh Salim's testimony was trusted by all people.

Career

Sheikh Abdul Basit Abdul Samad officially started his career as a Quran reciter in Cairo at the age of 23, when he was invited to attend the celebration of the birth of Sayyida Zainab. On the final night of the celebration, the guests were greeted by the top reciters of the era, namely Sheikh Abdul Fattah Al-Shashaa’i, Sheikh Mustafa Isma’il, Sheikh Abdul Azim Zahir, Sheikh Abu Al-Aynayn Sha’iisha, and others. The young Sheikh Abdul Basit was trying to find a place for him among the audience of listeners to listen to these famous giants, see them and sit with them.

After midnight, Sheikh Abdul Basit was accompanied by one of his relatives, who knew the officials in the Sayyida Zainab Mosque. He asked them for permission so that Sheikh Abdul Basit could also recite. He said: “I present to you a reader from Upper Egypt, whose voice is sweet and beautiful, and he will recite to you for ten minutes.” At that moment, the mosque was completely full to end, and the audience listened to his amazing voice that took the hearts of the listeners to the point that all attendees of the mosque yelled on top of his voice “Allah Akbar” (God is the greatest). Every time Sheikh Abdul Basit wanted to finish the recitation with “Sadaqallahul Azim” (Allah Almighty has spoken the truth), the audience insisted that he keeps on reading, and he did so for about two hours and finished the recitation in the early morning.

After this experience, Sheikh Abdul Basit began to think about applying to the radio station as a Quran reciter, but he hesitated a lot due to his affiliation with the Upper Egypt, nevertheless, he choose to pursue a career as a Quran reciter. Sheikh Abdul Basit was appointed as a Quran reciter on the radio in the year 1951.

Travels

Abdul Basit 'Abd us-Samad with King Faisal bin Abdulaziz of Saudi Arabia in the early 1970s

  • He travelled to Pakistan and was received by the Pakistani President at the airport.
  • In 1955, he travelled to Jakarta, Indonesia, where the people received him in the best way. The mosque was filled with attendees and they were outside the mosque for a distance of about a kilometer. The square opposite the mosque was filled with more than a quarter of a million Muslims listening to the Sheikh standing on their feet until dawn.
  • He also travelled to South Africa, and upon his arrival, officials sent him radio and television journalists to interview him.
  • He also travelled to India to celebrate a major religious ceremony held by one of the rich Muslims there. After his arrival, Sheikh Abdul Basit faced a moving situation. All those present were taking off their shoes and standing on the ground and they bowed their heads down looking at the place of prostration and their eyes overflowed with tears crying until the Sheikh finished recitation and his eyes tears shed from this humble attitude.
  • He also travelled to Jerusalem, Israel, and read in the Al-Aqsa Mosque as well as the Ibrahimi Mosque in Hebron in Palestine and the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus and the most famous mosques in Asia, Africa, the United States, France and London.

Honours and awards

Through the travels of Sheikh Abdul Basit Abdul Samad around the world, he received a large number of honours and awards.

  • In 1956, Syria honoured him and awarded him the Order of Merit. He received the Order of Cedar from Lebanon, the Golden Medal from Malaysia, a medal from Senegal, and another medal from Morocco.
  • A Medal from the Prime Minister of Syria in 1959.
  • A Medal from the Prime Minister of Malaysia in 1965.
  • The Order of Merit from the Senegalese President in 1975.
  • The Golden Medal from Pakistan in 1980.
  • The Order of Scholars from Pakistani President Zia-ul-Haq in 1984.
  • The Egyptian Radio Medal on its fiftieth anniversary.
  • The Order of Merit from the former Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak during the celebration of the Day of Preachers in 1987.
  • In 1990, he received the last honours after his departure from former President Mohamed Hosni Mubarak in the celebration of Laylat al-Qadr.

Illness and death

He suffered from complications from diabetes later in life, but his liver problems coincided with diabetes, and he could not fight these two conditions together. He contracted hepatitis less than a month before his death. He was admitted to a hospital but his health deteriorated further. This prompted his children and doctors to advise him to travel London for treatment, where he stayed for a week. He was accompanied by his son Tariq, who asked to take him back to Egypt.

He died on Wednesday, November 30, 1988, and his funeral was national and official at the local and global levels. The attendants of his funeral included ambassadors of various countries, as well as kings and heads of state. He was survived by his sons, namely, from oldest to youngest, Yasir, Hisham and Tariq. Following his father's footsteps, Yasir also became a Qari. In 2006, a mosque in his native village of Armant in Luxor, Southern Egypt, was opened under his name.

Name: Abdullah Basfar
BioText:
Abdullah Alkhayl Basfar was born in 1381 Hijrah. He graduated from the University of King Abdul Aziz in Jeddah in 1406 Hijrah and later obtained his Master’s degree in Fiqh and Usool from Umm al Qura University in 1412 Hijrah. Continuing his academic pursuit, he earned his doctorate in Fiqh in 1419 Hijrah.

Recognized as a Qari during the Ramadan Qur’an Recitation nights in Jeddah, Abdullah Basfar has held numerous prestigious positions and received accolades throughout his career:

  • Imam of Masjid Mansour El Shaabi in Jeddah
  • Member of the Scholar Association at the University of King Abdul Aziz
  • General Secretary of the International League of Quran Studies and Learning (Tahfid al Quran)
  • President of the International Instance for Holy Qur’an Memorization in association with the Muslim World League

Abdullah Basfar has rewritten the Quran four times and has organized conferences to raise awareness on various topics. He is also a prolific writer, with works including reflections on Surah al Fatihah (Meditations on Al Fatiha), Surah al Baqarah, Lights on the Quran Management, A Journey with the Signs of Surat Yusuf, Ramadan: Verses and Facts, Al Seddik Biography, and Purification of the Soul, among others.

In addition to his literary contributions, he delivers lectures and runs awareness programs on topics such as terrorism, poverty, and other social issues.

Personal Information

  • Full Name: Abdullah Alkhayl Basfar
  • Date of Birth: 1381 Hijrah
  • Education:
    • Bachelor’s Degree from University of King Abdul Aziz, Jeddah
    • Master’s Degree in Fiqh and Usool from Umm al Qura University
    • Doctorate in Fiqh

Accomplishments

  • Repeated rewriting of the Quran
  • Leadership in Quranic organizations and conferences
  • Authorship of multiple works on Quranic reflections and social issues
  • Delivery of lectures and awareness programs

Name: Abdullah al Juhany
BioText:
Abdullah Awad Al Juhany (Arabic: عبد الله عواد الجهني), is one of the nine Imams of the Grand Mosque Masjid al-Haram in Mecca. He holds a B.A. from the faculty of Qur'an at the Islamic University of Madinah, and a doctorate (Ph.D.) from Umm al-Qura University in Mecca.

Juhany has led the Taraweeh prayers during Ramadan in Mecca since 2005. His voice has been widely recorded and is internationally distributed by various communities.

Career

He was appointed as an imam of Masjid Al Haram, Mecca in July 2007. He is or has been an imam of Masjid Al Haram in Mecca, Masjid Al Nabawi in Medina, Masjid Quba and Masjid Qiblatain.

Name: Abdullah Matroud
BioText:
Abdullah Al Matrood is a well-known reciter from Saudi Arabia. His recitations are widely broadcasted in the media across the Arab world.

Abdullah Al Matrood has participated in various events focusing on topics such as The Human Creation, Al Farouq’s Biography, the Story of Musa and Firawn, and more.

Personal Information

  • Full Name: Abdullah Al Matrood
  • Nationality: Saudi Arabian

Accomplishments and Contributions

  • Renowned Quran reciter with wide media coverage in the Arab world
  • Participation in events focusing on various Islamic topics

  • He also travelled to India to celebrate a major religious ceremony held by one of the rich Muslims there. After his arrival, Sheikh Abdul Basit faced a moving situation. All those present were taking off their shoes and standing on the ground and they bowed their heads down looking at the place of prostration and their eyes overflowed with tears crying until the Sheikh finished recitation and his eyes tears shed from this humble attitude.
  • He also travelled to Jerusalem, Israel, and read in the Al-Aqsa Mosque as well as the Ibrahimi Mosque in Hebron in Palestine and the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus and the most famous mosques in Asia, Africa, the United States, France and London.

Honours and awards

Through the travels of Sheikh Abdul Basit Abdul Samad around the world, he received a large number of honours and awards.

  • In 1956, Syria honoured him and awarded him the Order of Merit. He received the Order of Cedar from Lebanon, the Golden Medal from Malaysia, a medal from Senegal, and another medal from Morocco.
  • A Medal from the Prime Minister of Syria in 1959.
  • A Medal from the Prime Minister of Malaysia in 1965.
  • The Order of Merit from the Senegalese President in 1975.
  • The Golden Medal from Pakistan in 1980.
  • The Order of Scholars from Pakistani President Zia-ul-Haq in 1984.
  • The Egyptian Radio Medal on its fiftieth anniversary.
  • The Order of Merit from the former Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak during the celebration of the Day of Preachers in 1987.
  • In 1990, he received the last honours after his departure from former President Mohamed Hosni Mubarak in the celebration of Laylat al-Qadr.

Illness and death

He suffered from complications from diabetes later in life, but his liver problems coincided with diabetes, and he could not fight these two conditions together. He contracted hepatitis less than a month before his death. He was admitted to a hospital but his health deteriorated further. This prompted his children and doctors to advise him to travel London for treatment, where he stayed for a week. He was accompanied by his son Tariq, who asked to take him back to Egypt.

He died on Wednesday, November 30, 1988, and his funeral was national and official at the local and global levels. The attendants of his funeral included ambassadors of various countries, as well as kings and heads of state. He was survived by his sons, namely, from oldest to youngest, Yasir, Hisham and Tariq. Following his father's footsteps, Yasir also became a Qari. In 2006, a mosque in his native village of Armant in Luxor, Southern Egypt, was opened under his name.

Name: Abdul Muhsin al Qasim
BioText:
Born in the city of Makkah, in 1388 Hijrah, Sheikh Abdul Muhsin al Qasim grew up under the shade of Islamic knowledge due to the involvement of his father’s and grandfather’s in scholarly groups (Fatwas of Sheikh Al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah and the Fatwas of the imams of Najd).

The Sheikh memorized the Qur’an and became a student of knowledge at a very young age. He studied under prominent Shuyookh, which include Sheikh Abdullah bin Humaid Rahimahullah, Abdul-Aziz bin Abd-Allah bin Baz Rahimahullah, Sheikh Salih bin Ali An-Nasir Rahimahullah, and Sheikh Al-Muhaddith Abdullah As-Sa’d.

In the year 1410 Hijrah, he graduated from the College of Sharia in Riyadh and secured his masters in the year 1413.

He began his career as a judge in Riyadh and in Tabook and thereafter, was appointed to the prestigious position of the Imam of Masjid An-Nabawi.

Besides that, the Sheikh has authored several books; few of which include Khutub Al-Munbariyya (khutbahs), Facilitating Attainment in the Explanation of the Three Usool, Book on Hanafi Fiqh, Formulated Annotation of the Masterpiece of (Scholars) in the Hanafi Fiqh and others.

The Sheikh is a distinguished Qari, a wise judge, an eloquent khateeb, and a man well known for his humble character, and keenness in learning.

Name: Abdur Rasheed Sufi
BioText:
Abdul Rashid Ali Sufi is a Somali Qur’an reciter. He was born in 1964 to the reciter and preacher Ali Abdul Rahmane Sufi, who did a lot for the Qur’an recitation in Somalia.

Abdul Rashid Ali Sufi’s father has also taught numerous theologians. He built many schools and institutes for teaching and learning the Holy Qur’an. He founded the famous mosque of Mogadishu he called Al Cheikh Ali Sufi Mosque.

Abdul Rashid Ali Sufi first learnt the Qur’an at the mosque and finished memorizing it at the age of ten. He certainly owed to his father many of his skills. He taught him different recitations and the interpretations of the Qur’an and the Fiqh.

Abdul Rashid Ali Sufi went to Egypt in 1981 where he enrolled in the Qur’an Recitations institute and earned a high certificate in the ten recitations. In parallel, Abdul Rashid carried out studies in Al Azhar Mosque and was awarded by the late Cheikh Mohamed Ibn Ismail Al Hamdani two degrees in the ten recitations.

Name: Abu Bakr Ash-Shatri
BioText:
Abu Bakr al-Shatri was born in 1970 in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Abu Bakr Ibn Mohamed Al Shatri (also called Abi Abdarrahmane) is a renowned Saudi Imam and a Qur’an reciter par excellence.

With perseverance, he graduated in Holy Qur’an from Sheikh Aymane Rochdi Suwaid in 1996.

Abu Bakr Al Shatri has had the privilege of leading prayers in many Saudi Masjids like Al Rajihi, Said Ibn Jubair (Kandara), Abdullatif Jamil, Attakwa (Al Rawda), and AChouiaibi (Assalama).

He has been a part of numerous Islamic conferences and events in many Islamic nations like Egypt, Morocco, South Africa, Kuwait, and Bahrain to name a few.

He is currently the Imam of Al Furkane Mosque in Hay Annassim, Jeddah.

Name: Ahmed ibn Ali al-Ajamy
BioText:
Early Life and Education

Ahmed bin Ali Al-Ajmi was born in Khobar, Saudi Arabia in 1968. He grew up in a religious family and developed an interest in the Quran from a young age. Ahmed Al-Ajmi attended elementary school in the Al-Mohammadiya School in southern Khobar, went to middle school in Al-Zubair bin Al-Awwam Middle School, and completed high school at Khobar Highschool in Khobar (specifically Madinat Al-Umal مدينة العمال). After finishing high school, he attended Imam Muhammad ibn Saud Islamic University and graduated with a bachelor’s degree in Sharia.

Career

After completing his education, Al-Ajmi began his career as a Quran reciter. He quickly gained popularity for his melodious and emotional recitation of the holy book. He has released several albums of his recitation, which have been widely distributed and have become popular in many countries around the world.

In addition to his recitation career, Al-Ajmi is also an imam and khateeb. He regularly leads prayers and gives sermons at mosques in Saudi Arabia and other countries. He also gives lectures and workshops on the Quran and its teachings.

Personal Life

Al-Ajmi is married and has children. He is a devout Muslim and is known for his piety and dedication to the Quran. He is also known for his charity work, and has supported various humanitarian causes throughout his career.

Conclusion

Ahmed bin Ali Al-Ajmi is one of the most popular Quran reciters in the Muslim world. His melodious and emotional recitation has touched the hearts of many, and his albums have become popular in many countries. He is also an accomplished imam and khateeb, and a dedicated philanthropist. His dedication to the Quran and his desire to spread its teachings have made him a respected figure in the Muslim community.

Name: Akram Al-Alaqmi
BioText:
His full name is Sheikh Akram Al Sayid Abdullah Ismail Al Aalakmi, one of Egypt’s most popular Quran readers. He is famous for the beauty of his voice and for his talent during the “Tajweed”. He is one of those Quran readers who confirm the following quote: “The holy Quran was revealed in Mecca, written in Istanbul, and read in Egypt”.

Sheikh Akram Al Aalakmi was born on Friday, 24th December, 1971, in Egypt. He had within him religious tendencies since his beginnings, as he decided to study the “Quranic readings sciences”. He received a high certification in the “Ten readings”, a certification and an accreditation according to Hafas Aan Assem’s recitation method, as well as a recommendation from Sheikh Issa Al Maasaraoui. He is currently a student in the last phase of specialization at the Institute of readings.

After his graduation, Sheikh Akram was appointed as an Imam in numerous mosques. The first one was “Abdullah Bin Masaud” mosque as an Imam and a preacher, then in “Ansar Al Suna Al Muhammadia” mosque as an Imam, then in “Chabab Al Islam” mosque that is affiliated to “Ansar Al Suna” association covering the Imamate task, and then he was appointed as a preacher in “Abdullah Bin Masaud” mosque, that is associated with the “ministry of Awqaf”.

Besides that, Sheikh “Akram Al Aalakmi” was assigned the Imamate for “Al Qiyam” and “Taraweeh” prayers in several Arabic countries, as well as teaching the holy Quran for more than twenty five years. Also, “Al Majd” channel, “Al Hafid” channel, and “Al Fajr” channel gave him the opportunity to recite the holy Quran.

Name: Ali Jaber
BioText:
Abdullah Ali Jabir was born in Jeddah in 1373 Hijrah. He memorized the Qur’an at the tender age of 15 in Makkah.

At the age of 23, Abdullah Ali Jabir graduated from the Sharia’s Faculty of the Islamic University. Thereafter, he went on to conduct research on ‘Abdullah Ibn Omar’s Fiqh and its Impact on Madinah’s School’ and received his doctorate in 1407 Hijrah. He became the Imam of Masjid al-Haram in the same year.

The Sheikh assumed the position of Administrative Inspector, shortly after which he joined the King Fahd Abdul Aziz University as a professor of Arab Language and Islamic studies.

An Imam and Qari of various mosques in Saudi Arabia, Abdullah Ali Jabir was appointed as the Custodian of the two holy mosques. However, he opted to lead the evening prayers in Ramadan.

The world lost this beautiful voice in 1426 Hijrah when Sheikh Abdullah Ali Jabir succumbed to a severe illness.

Name: Aziz Alili
BioText:
Aziz Alili was born in 1968 in Lipkovo municipality of Kumanovo in Macedonia. He is a Macedonian who is aptly trained in the recitation of the Holy Qur’an in Sarajevo. He finished primary school in his native town after which he entered the Gaza Husrevbeg’s Madrasa in Sarajevo.

In the period from 1984 to 1986, he was designated the Muezzin of Gazi Husrev Bey’s Mosque in Sarajevo and from 1989 to 1993.

From 1995, he worked as an Imam and Khatib in Zagreb.

At the Institute of Erkam bin Erkam in the Haram al-Sharif, Makkah, he studied ten Kira under the able guidance of Sheikh Abdul Abdeddaim Settir Al-Maghribiya and received Ijazah.

He is well versed with many beautiful and soulful Nasheeds and is credited with the production of various albums and cassettes.

He is currently serving the Muslim community as the Imam of Majlis Islamske Zajednice in Zagreb, Croatia.

Name: Bandar Baleela
BioText:
Bandar Baleela was born in 1975 in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. Bandar bin Abdulaziz bin Siraj bin Abdul Malik Baleelah stands tall as one of the most eminent and distinguished Shaykhs of all time characterized by his soulful and heartwarming recitations of the Holy Qur’an.

To gather deep insight into the Islamic Sharia, Sheikh Bandar Abdul Aziz enrolled into the Umm Al Qura University from where he mastered in 2002 in Al-Fiqh from the University of Shari’a and Islamic studies from where he was also honored with a Ph.D. for the same in the year 2008.

Sheikh Bandar Balila has taught Al-Fiqh in the Institute of “Al Haram Al Makki Al Sharif” as well as rendered services as a professor of faculty in Shariah in “Al Taif” University.

He leads the prayers as an Imam in Al Amira Nouf mosque in Al Aziziyah, Mecca.

After being appointed for leading Taraweeh in Masjid Al Haram in Ramadan on a temporary basis, he was awarded the permanency for the same in the year 2013.

After the official issuing of a Royal Decree by HH King Salman in the year 2016, Sheikh Baleelah was honored with the coveted position of leading as Imam and Khateeb of Istisqa Prayer.

Name: Fares Abbad
BioText:
Fares Abbad was born in Sanaa, Yemen on April 12th, 1980. Fares Abd Rabbuh Mohammed Abbad is a Yemeni Qur’an reciter par excellence.

His interest and inclination towards the Holy Quran started since he was a little boy. Sheikh Fadl Morad taught and helped him master the technique of reciting the Quran. He sought inspiration from and looked up to the gems of the Islamic world, namely, Abdul Basit Abdul Samad and Mohamed Al Mohisni.

He started as an Imam of Tarawih prayers at Bilal Ibn Rabah Mosque in 1994 and maintained this designation for 7 years. In 2004, Sheikh Fares Abbad became the imam of Sheikh Abdel Razek Afifi Mosque in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. He also led prayers as an Imam at Ali bin Abi Talib Mosque for two years starting in 2006, located in the east of Saudi Arabia, before moving to Ajman in the United Arab Emirates where he currently resides.

His fame and adulation started gaining prominence through his audio recordings, notably the complete Quran recited in 2003, which was financed by Qadisiya Records company. He passionately supported the publication of his performances. His much-publicized and soulful poem “Nounia Al Qahtani”, composed of eight hundred verses, was brought to life in his melodious and mesmerizing baritone. He has also recorded The Introduction of Ibn Al Qayem (the Paradise Description), The Day 2 Sides Reminders, The Possession Spell, and The Magic Spell.

He is currently preparing to present “The Fortress of Muslim” with a new approach and perspective.

His melodious voice resonates on Almajd Channel TV, where he is currently achieving tremendous success.

Name: Hani Ar-Rifai
BioText:
Hani Ar Rifai was born in the city of Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Sheikh Hani Ar-Rifai is the Imam and Khateeb of Masjid Anani in the same city.

During his learning of the Holy Quran, the esteemed Shaykh had the privilege of being in the company of and attaining knowledge from other well-known Shuyookh such as Shaykh Muhammad Ibn Abdu Rahim Achichin, Sheikh Ali Jaber, and Sheikh Muhammad Yusuf.

He completed his specialization in Islamic Studies at King Abdulaziz University and sought education under the guidance of prominent scholars and sheikhs such as Shaykh Al-allamah Abdullah Bin Bayyah, Sheikh Khaldoun Al-Ahdab, and Sheikh Ali Jaber, among others.

Owing to his emotional and soul-warming rendition of the Book of Allah, Sheikh Hani Ar-Rifai was elected as a special reciter of the Holy Quran in the Royal Court by the Saudi Ministry of Culture and Information.

He was granted the coveted designation as the Director of the legal affairs of King Faysal’s Hospital and the Research Center in Jeddah.

Name: Ali Al-Hudhaify
BioText:
Ali Abdur-Rahman al-Huthaify was born in 1947 in Saudi Arabia and is a well-known Imam in Saudi Arabia. He grew up in a religious environment with his father, Muhammad Abdul Hudaify, being a scholar and an Imam in the Saudi Arabian Army.

He received his preliminary education at the hands of the learned in his village and completed memorizing the Holy Quran under the guidance of Sheikh Mohammed bin Ibrahim Al Hodaifi. He also had good knowledge of forensic sciences.

In 1972, he graduated in Law from the Imam Muhammad bin Saud Islamic University and received his master’s degree in Islamic law from Al-Azhar University in 1975, where he also acquired his Ph.D.

In 1979, he was appointed as the Imam of the Quba Mosque in Madinah. Later that year, he was honored with the prestigious position of being the chief Imam of the Prophet’s Mosque – Al-Masjid al-Nabawi.

In 1981, during the month of Ramadan, he was appointed as the Imam of the Masjid al-Haram, and subsequently returned to the Great Mosque of Medina.

Name: Husary Broadcast
BioText:
Mahmoud Khalil Al-Husary was born in a village called Shobra Al Namla en Tant in Egypt.

He is a well renowned and eminent reciter of the Holy Qur’an. At the tender age of 8, he had already completed the Hifz of the whole Qur’an. By age 12, he had memorized and learned the ten recitations in Al Azhar.

In 1944, he made his debut on the radio with Quran recitation on 16 February 1944. On August 7, 1948, he was assigned the Muezzin of Sidi Hamza Mosque.

In 1949, Mahmoud Khalil Al-Husary was appointed as the Imam of Al Imam Al Hussein Mosque in Cairo, and by 1955, he had become one of the most esteemed and coveted Qur’an reciters of his time.

Name: Ibrahim Al-Akhdar
BioText:
Ibrahim Al Akhdar was born in Madina Munawara, Saudi Arabia, in 1945.

Sheikh Ibrahim Ibn Al Akhdar Al Kayim is a famous Holy Quran reciter and a devoted Imam.

To accomplish his educational process such as Dar Al-Hadith, he obtained from various Islamic schools. Simultaneously, Ibrahim worked on completing Hifz of the Holy Qur’an learning from eminent teachers like Omar Al Haydari, Sheikh Hassan Ibrahim Al Chair, Sheikh Amir Bin Sayed Othman, and Sheikh Ahmed Bin Abdulaziz Al-Zayat. He is also one of the privileged few who have mastered Aqidah, Fiqh, and language courses taught by Sheikh Abdullah Bin Mohammed Al Ghunaiman.

Ibrahim Al Akhdar taught in Abi Bin Kaab School in Madina Munawarah and later led prayers as Imam in the Holy Mosque of Jeddah. The Holy Qur’an Faculty and the Call Faculty of the Islamic University of Madina Munawarah sought his esteemed services as a teacher. He has also made a name for himself by imparting education in the Scientific Institute of Islamic Call relevant to the Imam University.

From 1986, for nine years, Sheikh Ibrahim Al Akhdar served as one of the Imams of the Holy Mosque of the Prophet.

Sheikh Ibrahim Al Akhdar is a very active social member of the community and contributes in various ways to the Holy Qur’an memorization activities in Saudi Arabia. He is involved in many committees and associations such as the Charitable Association of Social Services and the National and International Jury of the Holy Qur’an competition.

Sheikh Ibrahim Al Akhdar has organized numerous conferences and participated in Saudi TV channels. He has also produced a large number of audio tapes containing heartfelt and soulful Quranic recitations.

Name: Khaled Al-Muhanna
BioText:
Sheikh Khalid bin Sulaiman bin Abdullah Al Mohanna, an eminent and distinguished Imam of Saudi origin, graduated in Sunnah and pursued post-graduation in the Hidden Flaws and Knowledge of Men, culminating in a Ph.D. in the differences in Hadeeth.

Not one to be content with such achievements, he sought certification according to Chooba and Hafs from Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdul Hamid Al Iskandarani, and according to Hafs from Sheikh Ahmed Mustafa Abu Al Hassan, and finally according to Hafs Qasr Al Munfasil from Sheikh Abdul Rafii Ridwan.

After completing his extensive education, he joined the Faculty of Usool at Imam Muhammad bin Saud University.

His professional career as an Imam began at the prestigious mosque of Prince Mohammed bin Saud Bin Abdul Aziz in Hittin.

Name: Khalid Al-Qahtani
BioText:
The distinguished Sheikh Khaled Al Qahtani, born and bred in Saudi Arabia, has the Quran in his blood, making him a natural fit as a great Imam and preacher.

He is an active member in the media domain and is well-known in households as a celebrity.

Currently, Sheikh Khaled Al Qahtani serves at Masjid Abderrazak Qanbar in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, as an Imam par excellence.

Name: Maher Al Muaiqly (Haramain)
BioText:
Maher Al Mueaqly hails from the city of the Prophet.

Sheikh Maher Ibn Hamd Ibn Mueaql Al Mueaqly Al Baloui was born in 1969 and has become renowned in the world of Quran recitation and preaching.

A master in the study of Mathematics, Sheikh Maher began leading prayers in numerous Masajids in Makkah and Madinah, eventually becoming the official advisor to Prince Abdul Majid in Makkah, Saudi Arabia.

His career led him to teaching at King Abdullah Saud University in Makkah. In 2012, Sheikh Maher completed his Doctorate from Umm Al Qura University.

Initially serving as an Imam at Masjid Al Nabawi in 2006 and 2007, he was later appointed as the permanent Imam at Masjid Al Haram in Makkah in 2007, a landmark achievement. He had the honor of leading Taraweeh prayers alongside Sheikh Abdul Rahman Al Sudais in 2008.

Sheikh Maher has led prayers alongside other esteemed figures such as Sheikh Abdullah Awad Al Juhany and Sheikh Khalid Al Ghamdi. He served as Khateeb of Masjid Al Haram in Ramadan 2016 on the orders of King Salman.

Name: Minshawi Mujawwad
BioText:
Muhammad Siddiq al-Minshawi (January 1, 1920 – June 20, 1969) was an Egyptian Quranic reciter par excellence and a well-known figure in the world of Quran recitation. He was the son of the great Sheikh Siddiq al-Minshawi, and his brother Sheikh Mahmoud Al-Minshawi is also an eminent Quran reciter.

Sheikh Muhammad Siddiq al-Minshawi was mentored by the esteemed Sheikh Mohammed Salamah, who himself was a prominent reciter of the 20th century. He started learning Ilm e Tajweed at a young age under the guidance of distinguished Sheikh Ibrahim As-Su’udi.

Throughout his life, Sheikh Muhammad Siddiq al-Minshawi visited many countries, including Indonesia, Jordan, Kuwait, Libya, Palestine (Al-Aqsa Mosque), Saudi Arabia, and Syria, to spread and enhance knowledge of the Deen.

Name: Muhammad Jibreel
BioText:
Muhammad Al Said Hussayn Jibreel, better known as Sheikh Jibreel, is a Quran reciter of prominence and high repute.

He had gathered enough knowledge by doing the Hifz of the Holy Book of Allah by the age of nine and earned himself a BA degree in Islamic Law at Al-Azhar University.

He was appointed to lead the prayers as an Imam of the famous mosque Amr Ibn Al’Ass in Cairo in 1988.

Sheikh Jibreel is extremely famous for his “Dua Al Qunoot”.

Name: Mohammad al Tablawy
BioText:
Mohamed Mahmoud Tablawi, born on 14th November 1934 in a village called Met Oqba, Egypt, is a famous and devout Egyptian Imam and Qur’an reciter.

Mohamed Tablawi started memorizing the Holy Qur’an at the very tender age of four and attained Hifz at the age of ten. In 1956, Mohamed rightfully earned a degree from Al Azhar’s Recitations.

He made his religious services available to the Egyptian TV Channel on the recommendations of Sheikh Abd Al Fattah Al-Kadi and Sheikh Al Ghazali in 1956.

Mohamed Tablawi often organized recitations and debates over different relevant issues of Islam with the aim of enhancing the participation of youth in the Islamic movement and thinking.

Touted as the Man with the Golden Voice, Mohamed Tablawi has recited for notable personalities, including reciting the Holy Qur’an during the funerals of the Jordanian king Al Hussain’s mother, the late Moroccan king Hassan II, and Hafez Al Assad’s son, Bassel.

Name: Mostafa Ismaeel
BioText:
Sheikh Mustafa Ismail is one of the most known Quran readers in Egypt. He was born on June 17, 1905, in the small village of “Mit Ghazal” in the center of “Tanta” in the “Al Gharbiya” governorate.

Sheikh Mustafa Ismail was able to complete the memorization of the Holy Quran in his village at the age of twelve years old, and then he joined “Al Ahmadi” mosque in “Tanta” to master the sciences of Quran readings and “Tajweed”. Sheikh “Mohamed Refaat” had predicted for him a very bright future after having listened to his “Tilawat” and reading methods.

At first, Sheikh Mustafa Ismail became famous in all parts of “Al Gharbiya” province and neighboring provinces before one of his friends advised him to go to “Cairo” to try his luck there. He also had the chance to recite the holy Quran in a big celebration due to the absence of Sheikh “Abdelfatah Al Shaashai”.

Sheikh Mustafa Ismail was appointed as a reader of the Holy Quran in the royal palace during the reign of Farouk I, and thanks to that, he became famous in various Arab and Muslim countries.

Sheikh Mustafa Ismail passed away on Friday, December 12, 1978.

Maher Al Mueaqly hails from the city of the Prophet.

Name: Muhammad Ayyoub
BioText:
Mohamed Ayoub, born Mohamed Ayoub Ibn Mohamed Youssef Ibn Soulaimane Omar, is a Saudi Qur’an reciter and imam. He was born in 1372 Hijri in Makkah, Saudi Arabia.

Mohamed Ayoub grew up with the sound of the Holy Qur’an. He had memorized the Holy Book in Ibn Laden Mosque from which he graduated in 1386. He joined the Scientific Institute of Madinah soon after and left it with a degree in 1392. Later on, Mohamed entered the Islamic University where he earned his bachelor, master and doctorate in 1408.

His Islamic studies started a little earlier. Supervised by eminent Saudi Cheikhs like Abd Al Aziz Mohamed Othmane, Tantawi and Al Shankiti, Mohamed Ayoub profited from an accomplished, highly-qualified education.

Name: Minshawi Murattal
BioText:
Muhammad Siddiq al-Minshawi (January 1, 1920 – June 20, 1969) was an Egyptian Quranic reciter par excellence and a well-known figure in the world of Quran recitation. He was the son of the great Sheikh Siddiq al-Minshawi, and his brother Sheikh Mahmoud Al-Minshawi is also an eminent Quran reciter.

Sheikh Muhammad Siddiq al-Minshawi was mentored by the esteemed Sheikh Mohammed Salamah, who himself was a prominent reciter of the 20th century. He started learning Ilm e Tajweed at a young age under the guidance of distinguished Sheikh Ibrahim As-Su’udi.

Throughout his life, Sheikh Muhammad Siddiq al-Minshawi visited many countries, including Indonesia, Jordan, Kuwait, Libya, Palestine (Al-Aqsa Mosque), Saudi Arabia, and Syria, to spread and enhance knowledge of the Deen.

Name: Nabil Rifai
BioText:
Sheikh Nabil Bin Sheikh Abdul Rahim Rifai is an eminent and highly reputed Saudi Qur’an reciter born in 1977 in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.

Sheikh Ar Rifai gathered knowledge and the nuances of the Holy Qur’an from esteemed Sheikhs such as Sheikh Abdel Aziz Ramadan, Sheikh Abdel Wahab Hadiri, and the late Sheikh Ali Jaber. Nabil Ar Rifai has also the credit of being a graduate of the Engineering Faculty of King Fahd Abdul Aziz University.

In 1994, Sheikh Nabil Ar Rifai began leading Tarawih prayers as an Imam in the Ramadan Mosque of Baghdadi.

Name: Nasser Al Qatami
BioText:
Sheikh Nasser Al Qatami is born in Riyadh in 1980. He is among the famous reciters in the Persian Gulf and the Arab world.

He has acquired a bachelor’s degree in Islamic studies and has also the fortune of being awarded an honorary doctorate from Al Hayat University in the Egyptian capital Cairo. He was captivated and mesmerized by the best reciters, such as Sheikh Bakri Tarabichi, Sheikh Mohammad Ayub, and Sheikh Mahmoud Sokar.

He commenced Imamat at a young age of 14, he has various accolades to his credit which includes his chairmanship in the administrative council of the Ayat Al Quran Al Karim group, and his membership at the Saudi scientific association of the Quran and its sciences.

He is presently the Imam and the Khatib of the Princess Latifa Bint Sultan Bin Abdulaziz mosque in Riyadh.

Name: Noreen Siddiq
BioText:
Noreen Mohammad Siddiq (Arabic: نُورِين مُحَمَّد صِدِّيق, first name also spelled Norayn, Nurain, Nureyn, last name also spelled Siddig or Siddique) (1982 – 7 November 2020) was a Sudanese imam who was known for his recitations of the Quran. He was an imam of the Khartoum Grand Mosque, the Sayeda Sanhori Mosque, the Al-Nour Mosque, and other famous mosques within the capital city of Sudan, Khartoum.

He died in a car crash at the age of 38.

Personal Life

Siddiq had four wives and eight children, both male and female, with his eldest child being a female.

Biography

Siddiq was born in 1982 in a town called Farajab, Sudan. In 1998, he enrolled in khalwa school in Khorsi and became a student of the renowned scholar Sheikh Makki in Sudan. After graduation, he continued his studies of Islam in Khorsi, spending 20 years seeking education under various scholars. Later, he became a disciple of Sheikh Makki in Khartoum, the capital of Sudan. Siddiq was born in Umm Dam locality in North Kordofan state and grew up in a spiritual household. At the age of 17, he memorized the Qur’an in the qira'at of Al-Douri 'an Abi 'Amr and Hafs. He later enrolled in the Islamic Holy Quran University, where he graduated. Siddiq participated in several international Qur'an competitions, notably placing in competitions in Malaysia, Dubai, Saudi Arabia, and Libya.

Siddiq gained popularity across the Muslim world through videos of his recitations on social media. Several videos of Siddiq have garnered millions of views on YouTube.

On 7 November 2020, Siddiq was killed in a car accident in Khartoum at the age of 38. Three other reciters of the Quran were also killed: Ali Yaqoub, Abdullah Awad Al-Karim, and Muhannad Al-Kinani. A fourth reciter, Sayed bin Omar, was injured. The group was about 18 kilometers from Omdurman returning from Wadi Halfa when their car allegedly collided with a truck. There was an outpouring of tributes shared on social media after his death.

Style of Recitation

Siddiq's recitation of the Qur'an has been described as sad, soulful, and bluesy. His unique sound made him one of the Muslim world's most popular reciters. Siddiq's recitation mirrored the five-note or pentatonic scale that is common in Muslim-majority regions of the Sahel and the Horn of Africa.

After his passing, Omar Suleiman tweeted, The world has lost one of the most beautiful [voices] of our time.

Hind Makki, a Sudanese-American interfaith educator, said regarding Siddiq's recitation, There is an African authenticity that people point to even if they are not able to articulate exactly what it is and they like it.

Siddiq was able to recite in the qira'at of Al Douri 'an Abi 'Amr and Hafs.

Name: Saad Al-Ghamdi
BioText:
Saad al-Ghamdi was born in Dammam, Saudi Arabia in 1967. He is a reciter of the Holy Qur’an beyond excellence, and his body of work is proof enough to commemorate this very fact, bearing a striking resemblance to the style and texture of the great Mishary Rashid Al-Afasy.

Saad al-Ghamdi has a fine mind for garnering valuable knowledge, and this persisted right until he obtained his Bachelor’s degree from the University of Sharia in the Imam Mohammed Ibn Saud’s university in Al-Ahsaa in the discipline of Oussoul Din, while simultaneously also procuring the coveted Al Isnad from Riwaya of Hafs’ An Aasim.

His magnanimous career graph has seen monumental heights with professions like teaching, guiding towards Islamic Sciences, supervising the theological education at Manar al Huda Centre, and also being designated as a director in Mohamed Al Fateh’s private schools in Dammam.

Saad al-Ghamdi is now at present rendering his extraordinary services by conducting Imamat at Yusuf Bin Ahmed Mosque, Dammam after initially commencing at the blessed and holy Masjid An-Nabawi in Medina, Saudi Arabia.

Name: Saood Ash-Shuraym
BioText:
Saud ibn Ibrahim ibn Muhammad al-Shuraim (Arabic: سعود بن ابراهيم بن محمد الشريم); born 19 January 1966) is a Quranic reciter who was one of the prayer leaders and Friday preachers at the Grand Mosque Masjid al-Haram in Makkah. He also holds a Ph.D degree in Sharia (Islamic studies) at the Umm al-Qura University in Mecca. Shuraim was recently appointed as dean and Specialist Professor in Fiqh at the University.

Shuraim used to lead the Taraweeh prayers during Ramadan in Mecca since 1991. He also led the funeral prayer for Crown Prince Nayef bin Abdulaziz on 17 June 2012 after Maghrib (sunset) prayer in Masjid al-Haram, at which King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia and the royal families were present.

Career

In 1991, he was made a prayer leader and Friday preacher at the Grand Mosque by the order of King Fahd. A year after that, he was appointed judge in the High court of Makkah. Further to this, he was approved and made to teach in the Holy Masjid al-Haram. He has been serving as a professor at the Umm al-Qura University in Makkah since 1995, and has been named the dean of the faculty of Shari'ah and Islamic Studies. In June 2010, he was promoted from the rank of professor to the specialist professor in fiqh by the president of the university Bakri bin Mat'ooq. He is currently retired.

On 6 April 2018, Saudi authorities closed Sheikh Shuraim’s twitter page because he had posted comments about political and social issues in the Kingdom and criticised what he believed are violations of Islamic teachings.

In December 2022, Shuraim stepped down as Imam of Masjid al-Haram. He bid farewell to his position through a self-written poem.

Personal Life

Shuraim's family is from the Haraqees of the Banu Zayd tribe of Saudi Arabia.

In an interview with the Al Watan newspaper, when asked about his wife's role in his success, Shuraim stated:

Before I say something about my wife, I can't forget my mother's love and mercy for me in my childhood and youth as well; As she raised me in orphanage in childhood... her love is a tonic for me. May Allah shower His mercy upon her as she did with me when I was a child.

And as for my wife, she has proven herself to be the best companion for me in happiness and sorrow, she is there when I need her, cheers me up, and tries her best to lighten my sorrows. May Allah include this in her good deeds.

Name: Sahl Yaseen
BioText:
Sahl Ibn Zin Yasin is an excellent Imam and a master of tilawat of the Qur’an and Tajweed who is of Saudi Arabian nativity. He is a personality to reckon with the amazing quality of his psalmody which has mesmerized the Muslim Ummah no end.

Presently, Shaykh Sahl is conducting Imamat at the renowned Masjid Al Amir Sultan Mosque, Jeddah.

Name: Salah Budair
BioText:
Salah Ibn Muhammad Al-Budair is born in Al Hofuf in Saudi Arabia. He is a renowned Imam, Qur’an reciter, and preacher par excellence.

Salah Al-Budair started leading prayers while he was still in high school, in 1985. Salah graduated from Al Oum Mohamed Ben Saud Islamic University for Sharia’s studies, which was followed by a specialization from the Institute of Higher Learning in (Islamic) Law.

Currently, Shaykh Salah is leading prayers as the permanent Imam of the Prophet’s Mosque – Masjid E Nabawi in Medina, Saudi Arabia while simultaneously also managing the coveted designation of being a judge in the High Court of Medina.

Name: Salah Bukhatir
BioText:
Salah Bukhatir is native to the United Arab Emirates. He is a Qur’an Reciter and preacher of undeniable good repute and owner of a heartwarming psalmody alike to the great Shaykh Sudais.

Shaykh Salah is currently rendering his services conducting Imamat at the Sheikh Saoud Al Qassimi Mosque and the Prophet’s Mosque, Medina, Saudi Arabia.

Name: Yasser Ad-Dussary
BioText:
Yasser ibn Rashed al-Dosari (Arabic: ياسر بن راشد الدوسري), born on 6 August 1980, is an imam, khatib, and qāriʾ from Saudi Arabia. He has been one of the imams of Masjid al-Haram since 12 October 2019. Previously, he was an imam of Taraweeh and Tahajjud at Masjid al-Haram from 2015 and also an imam at several mosques in Riyadh since 1995. Al-Dosari was a student of a group of 'ulama and sheikhs, including Abdulaziz Al Sheikh, Saleh Al-Fawzan, and Abdullah ibn Jibreen. He also learned qira'at with several shuyukh and qaris, including Bakri Al-Tarabisyi and Ibrahim Al-Akhdar.

Career

Imam of Masjid Al-Haram

On 29 Sha'ban 1436 H (15 June 2015), King Salman bin Abdulaziz issued an order for Al-Dosari to become one of the Imams of Taraweeh and Tahajjud at Masjid Al-Haram during Ramadan. He carried out that order for five years. On 13 Safar 1441 H (12 October 2019), King Salman appointed Sheikh Yasser as a permanent imam at Masjid Al-Haram. Believed to be the youngest Imam appointed at the Grand Mosque in Makkah, he led his first prayer in Masjid Al-Haram during the Maghrib and Isha Prayers on Saturday, 13 October 2019.

Apart from being an imam, Al-Dosari is also an adviser to General Presidency of Haramain since 2020. He was appointed for that position after Abdul-Rahman Al-Sudais, Head of the General Presidency of Haramain, decided to reorganize the ranks of the advisory body of that government agency.

Khatib of Masjid Al-Haram

After about three years of becoming an imam of Masjid Al-Haram, Sheikh as-Sudais announced that Al-Dosari was appointed as a khatib of Masjid Al-Haram with King Salman's approval in December 2022.

End of First Contract

After completion of his 4-year contract as Imam, Sheikh Yasser was excused from the post in October 2023 Many called for his return, with a survey receiving a 94% pushback against his exemption.

Second Contract

Six months after the contract expiration, on Shaʻban 26, 1445 (03/07/2024), Sheikh Abdul Rahman As Sudais announced the re-appointment of Sheikh Yasser Al-Dosari as the Imam of Masjid al-Haram. Sheikh Al-Dosari led the Taraweeh prayers during Ramadan 1445 (2024).
